workflows.name: Multi-Scene Product Commercial Creation
workflows.description: Create unlimited-length product commercials by chaining multiple video scenes using frame control to achieve seamless transitions
steps: Step 1: Prepare start frame (product image on white background)
Step 2: Use Nano Banana on OpenArt to create end frame (modify background to black, rotate product if needed)
Step 3: Navigate to Video section in OpenArt
Step 4: Select Google Veo 3.1 model
Step 5: Upload start frame and end frame
Step 6: Write scene prompt with camera movements (e.g., 'At 2s: camera begins slow dolly-in, At 3s: 180Â° orbit around product, Finally: zoom out to reveal studio environment')
Step 7: Generate Scene 1 (5-15 seconds)
Step 8: Download Scene 1 video and extract final frame
Step 9: Use final frame as new start frame for Scene 2
Step 10: Create new end frame for Scene 2 (different environment, e.g., outer space)
Step 11: Generate Scene 2 with new prompt and camera movements
Step 12: Repeat frame swapping and scene generation for unlimited length
Step 13: Download all scene videos
Step 14: Optional: Stitch scenes together in video editor (or use as separate social media posts)
workflows.automation_potential: High 60-80% (frame generation, video generation automated; creative direction manual)
workflows.output: Unlimited-length product commercial with seamless scene transitions
business_value: 98% cost reduction vs traditional video production ($50-200 AI credits vs $5,000-50,000 traditional)
95% time savings (40-60 minutes vs 3-7 days)
Unlimited creative iterations without additional cost
Enables small businesses to create Apple-quality commercials
No location scouting, crew, or equipment needed
Immediate deployment for product launches
prerequisites: Product image (or ability to generate with AI)
Access to Google Veo 3.1 on OpenArt
Basic understanding of camera movements and cinematography
key_insights: Frame control enables unlimited-length videos by chaining scenes
End frame of Scene 1 becomes start frame of Scene 2 for seamless transitions
Time-based camera prompts create professional cinematography
Each scene can have completely different environment while maintaining product consistency
No need for traditional video editing skills

workflows.name: Multi-Image Reference Video Generation (Elements Feature)
workflows.description: Create realistic narrative videos using 1-3 reference images (character portraits, objects, environments) for social media storytelling
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Image section in OpenArt
Step 2: Generate character portrait using OpenArt Photorealistic (e.g., 'Woman in casual attire, warm smile, outdoor lighting')
Step 3: Download character portrait
Step 4: Switch to Seedream 4.0 model
Step 5: Generate object image (e.g., 'Beautifully weathered marble statue')
Step 6: Download object image
Step 7: Generate environment scene with Seedream 4.0 (e.g., 'Serene park at sunset with stone path')
Step 8: Download environment scene
Step 9: Navigate to Video section
Step 10: Select Google Veo 3.1 model
Step 11: Upload all 3 reference images to Elements feature (1-3 images supported)
Step 12: Write narrative prompt (e.g., 'Woman walks through park discussing the beauty of the statue, camera follows her as she gestures toward it')
Step 13: Generate video (5-15 seconds)
Step 14: Review output - video integrates all 3 references cohesively
Step 15: Download video for social media posting
workflows.automation_potential: Very High >80% (fully automated image and video generation)
workflows.output: Realistic social media narrative video featuring character, object, and environment
business_value: 98% cost reduction vs traditional video shoot with actors and locations
95% time savings (20 minutes vs 2-5 days)
No casting, location scouting, or crew needed
Enables diverse character representation without scheduling models
Unlimited creative iterations
Professional quality suitable for Instagram, TikTok, YouTube

use_case_examples.quality_assessment: Looks so realistic, feels natural, like an actual shot of someone filming their family member

prerequisites: Access to Google Veo 3.1, OpenArt Photorealistic, and Seedream 4.0
key_insights: Elements feature accepts 1-3 reference images for character, object, and environment
OpenArt Photorealistic excels at human portraits
Seedream 4.0 excels at objects and environments
All 3 images integrate cohesively in final video
Enables storytelling without actors or locations
Output quality rivals traditional video production

workflows.name: Brand Logo Animation Creation (Complex Composition)
workflows.description: Generate animated brand logos with complex compositions such as thousands of people forming logo shapes from aerial perspective
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Image section in OpenArt
Step 2: Select Flux Kontext model
Step 3: Write complex composition prompt (e.g., 'Aerial view of thousands of diverse people forming an infinity symbol logo, overhead perspective, synchronized movement, vibrant colors')
Step 4: Generate logo composition image
Step 5: Review for logo accuracy and composition quality
Step 6: Download logo image
Step 7: Navigate to Video section
Step 8: Select Google Veo 3.1 model
Step 9: Upload logo composition as reference image
Step 10: Write animation prompt (e.g., 'Camera slowly zooms out from overhead perspective as people move in synchronized waves, revealing full infinity logo')
Step 11: Specify camera movements and timing
Step 12: Generate animated video (5-15 seconds)
Step 13: Review logo animation quality
Step 14: Download for brand marketing use
workflows.automation_potential: High 60-80% (generation automated; creative direction and review manual)
workflows.output: Animated brand logo video with complex composition suitable for commercials and brand marketing
business_value: 99% cost reduction vs traditional production (CGI, crowds, aerial filming)
99% time savings (20 minutes vs 1-2 weeks)
No need for CGI artists, crowd casting, or drone operators
Enables small brands to create big-brand-quality logo animations
Unlimited creative iterations at minimal cost
Professional quality for TV commercials, social media, presentations

use_case_examples.composition: Thousands of artists forming infinity symbol

prerequisites: Access to Flux Kontext and Google Veo 3.1
Brand logo concept or existing logo
key_insights: Flux Kontext specialized in complex compositions with thousands of elements
Crowd scenes and brand logos benefit from Flux Kontext's capabilities
Aerial/overhead perspective works well for logo reveals
Complex compositions previously required expensive CGI teams
AI enables indie brands to compete with corporate production budgets

workflows.name: Unified AI Platform Workflow (Model Switching Optimization)
workflows.description: Optimize video production workflow by using OpenArt's unified platform to switch between image and video models without losing prompts or context
workflows.traditional_approach_time: Additional 15-30 min per project (context switching between platforms)
steps: Step 1: Log into OpenArt (single platform for all models)
Step 2: Navigate to Image section
Step 3: Generate reference images using model A (e.g., OpenArt Photorealistic)
Step 4: Switch to model B (e.g., Seedream 4.0) via dropdown - prompts automatically saved
Step 5: Generate additional images without re-entering context
Step 6: Navigate to Video section (same platform)
Step 7: Access previously generated images directly (no downloads/re-uploads needed)
Step 8: Switch between video model versions (Veo 3.0 vs 3.1) via dropdown
Step 9: Compare outputs without losing prompt history
Step 10: Select best model for final generation
Step 11: Generate final video with optimized model
Step 12: All assets remain accessible in unified library
workflows.automation_potential: Medium 40-60% (platform handles model switching; user directs workflow)
workflows.output: Streamlined multi-model video production workflow with centralized asset management
business_value: 50-70% reduction in platform navigation time
Eliminates context switching between multiple platforms
Automatic prompt history preservation
Seamless asset transfer from image to video generation
Enables rapid model comparison without re-prompting
Single subscription vs multiple platform costs

use_case_examples.traditional_approach: Use Midjourney for character, DALL-E for objects, RunwayML for video = 3 platforms, 3 logins, manual asset transfer
use_case_examples.openart_approach: Use OpenArt for all models = 1 platform, 1 login, automatic asset integration

prerequisites: Access to multiple models on OpenArt
key_insights: OpenArt provides unified interface for image, video, and audio AI models
Automatic prompt saving eliminates re-entering context when switching models
Generated images immediately accessible in video section without downloads
Model comparison enabled without losing workflow state
Platform aggregation significantly reduces friction in multi-model workflows
Single platform approach reduces cognitive load and context switching costs

beginner_path: WF-VIDEO-002 (Multi-Image Reference Video) - Simplest introduction to video generation

business_impact.democratization: Enables small businesses and indie creators to produce Fortune 500-quality video content
business_impact.speed_to_market: Launch product videos same-day vs weeks of production
business_impact.creative_iteration: Unlimited iterations at minimal cost enables rapid testing
business_impact.accessibility: No video production expertise required - just prompt engineering
business_impact.scalability: One person can produce unlimited videos vs hiring production teams

key_technologies.frame_control: Start/end frame control enables unlimited-length videos via scene chaining
key_technologies.elements_feature: Multi-image references (1-3 images) create cohesive narrative videos
key_technologies.time_based_prompts: Specify camera movements at timestamps for professional cinematography
key_technologies.platform_aggregation: Unified interface eliminates context switching between AI tools
key_technologies.model_specialization: Different models optimized for characters, objects, environments, complexity

model_specialization_guide.Seedream_4_0: Best for objects (statues, products) and environments (parks, interiors)
model_specialization_guide.Flux_Kontext: Best for complex compositions (crowds, brand logos, thousands of elements)
model_specialization_guide.Google_Veo_3_1: Best for video generation with frame control and Elements feature
model_specialization_guide.Nano_Banana: Best for product image editing (background changes, rotations)
